boardgame.name: Mindwalkers
boardgame.description:
Mindwalkers is a social deduction game in which players have the powerful ability to hijack the minds of their opponents, forcing them to do their bidding.

The game takes place over five days and four nights. During the day, players travel around the magical city of Elysia to work towards one of two main objectives: accumulating energy at The Origin, or banishing opponents from the council. Both are accomplished through voting, so securing the trust and cooperation of other players is key to victory. Players can also draw and play spells or magical artifacts to gain a strategic advantage.

At night, players further their agendas by Mindwalking one of their opponents. Mindwalks are issued by passing written commands to the victim, hidden from their opponents' view. These commands are open ended and completely up to the player's imagination!

The game ends when a player or faction completes their hidden win condition. Will you be the one pulling the strings over the council, or will you end up dancing to someone else's tune? Control your opponents. Control destiny.

boardgame.name: Aventuria: Spielmarken-Set – Blood Pack
boardgame.description:
Take your Aventuria game to a new level with these acrylic markers! This set of 41 high-quality acrylic markers helps you to keep an eye on the minions' life points in adventure mode. It contains 20 blood markers with 5 life points, 20 blood markers with one life point and 1 blood marker with 20 life points.

Publisher:
Hebe dein Aventuria-Spiel mit den Acryl-Markern auf eine neue Ebene! Dieses Set mit 41 hochwertigen Acrylmarkern hilft dir, die Lebenspunkte der Schergen im Abenteuermodus im Blick zu behalten. Enthalten sind 20 Blutmarker mit 5 Lebenspunkten, 20 Blutmarker mit einem Lebenspunkt und 1 Blutmarker mit 20 Lebenspunkten.

boardgame.name: Aventuria: Spielmarken-Set – Adventure Pack
boardgame.description:
Take your Aventuria game to a new level with these acrylic markers! This set of 26 high-quality acrylic markers will help you keep an eye on the challenges in Adventure mode. Contains 20 sword & axe markers with a value of 1, 5 sword & axe markers with a value of 5 and one sword & axe token with a value of 20.

Publisher:
Hebe dein Aventuria-Spiel mit den Acryl-Markern auf eine neue Ebene! Dieses Set mit 26 hochwertigen Acrylmarkern hilft dir, die Herausforderungen im Abenteuermodus im Blick zu behalten. Enthalten sind 20 Schwert&Axt-Marker mit Wert 1, 5 Schwert&Axt-Marker mit Wert 5 und ein Schwert&Axt-Marker mit Wert 20.

boardgame.name: Aventuria: Spielmarken-Set – Threat Pack
boardgame.description:
Take your Aventuria game to a new level with these acrylic markers! This set of 25 high-quality acrylic markers will help you keep an eye on the challenges in Adventure mode. Includes 10 hourglass and 15 skull markers.

Publisher:
Hebe dein Aventuria-Spiel mit den Acryl-Markern auf eine neue Ebene! Dieses Set mit 25 hochwertigen Acrylmarkern hilft dir, die Herausforderungen im Abenteuermodus im Blick zu behalten. Enthalten sind 10 Sanduhrmarker und 15 Schädelmarker.

boardgame.name: Aventuria: Spielmarken-Set – Forest Pack
boardgame.description:
Take your Aventuria game to a new level with these acrylic markers! This set of 21 high-quality acrylic markers will help you keep an eye on the challenges in Adventure mode. It contains 6 body control tokens, 8 pack tokens, 2 blood tokens with 5 life points and 5 blood tokens with one life point.

Publisher:
Hebe dein Aventuria-Spiel mit den Acryl-Markern auf eine neue Ebene! Dieses Set mit 21 hochwertigen Acrylmarkern hilft dir, die Herausforderungen im Abenteuermodus im Blick zu behalten. Enthalten sind 6 Körperbeherrschungsmarker, 8 Gepacktmarker, 2 Blutmarker mit 5 Lebenspunkten und 5 Blutmarker mit einem Lebenspunkt.

boardgame.name: Curry the Favor
boardgame.description:
In Curry the Favor, players take on the role of two friends that take turns buying each other lunch specials at a local restaurant. However, they always want to impress the other and give a better meal than the one that was last given to them.

Every turn in Curry the Favor, you will buy your friend a meal, trying to “one-up” the meal they last bought for you - in some aspect. But, you will want to spend your money wisely, because the player who received the most valuable meals in the end wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kit
boardgame.description:
Kit is an easy to learn game and fun for the avid card player or if you're a beginner. Rummy style game where you make kits or runs, make the right combinations, and be the first to go out - then watch your opponents scramble to cut their losses. The goal of the game is to be the player with the lowest score at the end of the 10th round by making your entire hand into kits and/or runs.

The game consists of two 44-card decks. Each deck has four WILD cards and four colors: Blue, Gold, Green, and Purple. Each color has ten cards, 3 through 12. Wild cards can be considered any number or color that you wish. There are also rotating wild cards that change every round. The rotating wild cards depend on the number of cards dealt that round. When 3 cards are dealt, the 3’s are wild, when 4 cards are dealt the 4’s are wild and so on until the last round when the 12’s are wild.

A kit is three or more cards of the same number and can be any color. You can have as many wild cards in a kit as you want. A run is three or more consecutive cards of the same color. A wild card can replace any card in a run. You can have as many wild cards in a run as you want and they can be adjacent to one another.

Dealing:
1. Shuffle both decks of cards together.
2. For the first round deal 3 cards to each player, dealing one card at a time. Note: For each round of play, the number of cards dealt increases by one card. In the second round 4 cards are dealt, in the third round 5 cards are dealt, and so on until dealing 12 cards to each player in the final round. The dealer position rotates after each round.
3. Place the remaining cards in the center of the table and turn over the top card. The stack of cards is the draw pile and the card turned up is the start of the discard pile.

Playing:
1. The player to the left of the dealer goes first and play continues clockwise.
2. Start your turn by taking the top card on the discard pile or drawing a card.
3. Complete your turn by discarding one card.
4. Continue to make kits and/or runs until you are able to go out.
5. Going out: Once all of the cards in your hand are part of a kit or run, lay down all of your cards face up on the table before discarding your last card.
Note: you must be able to make kits and runs from the exact number of cards dealt in the round. You must have one card left to discard. You can go out on your very first turn.
6. Once a player has gone out, all other players have one final turn. Start your turn as normal and after discarding, lay down your kits and runs. Any cards that do not fit in a kit or run will count toward your score.
7. The cards that are in kits and runs do not count toward your score. Players add up only their unused cards. The card values are equal to the number on the card and Wild cards are worth 20 points. The player that goes out first gets a score of -5. The scorekeeper records and adds up the score for each player.
8. The player to the dealer’s left shuffles all of the cards and deals the next round.
Note: Increase the number of cards dealt by one card and keep track of the rotating Wild cards

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Tipping the Scales
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
First Quick Quest for TFT, you are tasked with the recovery of a Lens of Translation after the first group failed.

boardgame.name: The Fantasy Trip Adventures 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Five new adventures, each with die-cut game counters, for The Fantasy Trip. This book includes:

Old School Adventure by Steve Jackson
Darkness by Tony R. Van Liew
The Paradise Vault by Howard Kistler
The Shining Tower by David L. Pulver
Amazons of the Sky Turtle by Henry J. Cobb
And an afterword, with further game notes, by Steve Jackson

boardgame.name: Old School Monsters
boardgame.description:
Publishers Blurb:
They might be old...but that just makes them more dangerous!

55 Monsters from the oldest of old-school games, compiled under the OGL, and translated to The Fantasy Trip by Steve Jackson himself. Negotiate with the Grippli! Flee fromthe fearsome Gnolls and their Flind Masters! Find a way around the Gelatinous Cube, and think fast, because it's still coming...

Each monster comes with stats, description, at least one suggested encounter, and at least one game counter. Except for the Throat Leech and the Ear Seeker, because you don't see them coming...Also included with this set are double-sized cards for each monster, with a picture and basic encounter information.

boardgame.name: Empty Thrones
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Uhl is Dead.
The First Minister of Iopos has died with no proclaimed heir. Spies and schemers orbit the presumed assassination, backed by those desperate to claim the Malachite Seat. Throughout Barsaive, events spiral out from this unexpected moment, calling out for heroes.
Iopos rots from within and trustworthy resources are needed to infiltrate the Copper Branch of Councilor Plaza. Jerris senses weakness and agitates for their freedom. False identities, lies, and coercion lead Cara Fahd to the brink of war. Kratas is betrayed by their allies. The Great Dragons seek to ensure Iopos is unable to lay claim to an unstoppable weapon.

This sourcebook provides the information needed to run each of these events - whether separately or in an epic-style campaign that spans Western Barsaive. Additionally, this book fleshes out four locales you can use for further adventures: Councilor Plaza, a district in Iopos' Clansward; the citadels of occupied Jerris; the fishing village of Freewater on the border of Cara Fahd; and Kratas' port-city of Daiche.

Can you influence who will ascend to Barsaive's Empty Thrones?

boardgame.name: Legends of Barsaive: Haven Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Legends born in the shadows of ruin.
The adventurer’s paradise of Haven flourishes, while a dark power within the adjacent ruins of Parlainth stirs. Parlainth was once Thera’s crown jewel in Barsaive, but the opulent city was brought low during the Scourge. When Namegivers first returned to the world, a group of adepts came together to found a town on the ruin’s borders. From this town, countless young heroes have embarked on quests for fortune and glory.

Nearly five years after the end of the Second Theran War, more heroes than ever before flock to the chaotic frontier town. The troll explorer-turned-mayor, Torgak,is getting on in years. The Association of Unaffiliated Explorers agitates for fair and balanced elections to appoint his replacement. The dwarf merchants of Throal and vested Theran interests eye the changing market hungrily. With so many looking to Haven’s political future, it has fallen to private interests, the Adventuring Companies of Haven, to ensure that Barsaive’s next generation of heroes do not fall to ignoble fates.

This sourcebook provides a description of Haven’s history and lays out its prominent players as of 1517 TH. It provides additional rules and guidelines for players as well as gamemasters who wish to participate in the Earthdawn community’s Legends of Barsaive adventures that are run at various tables around the globe. This text also provides guidelines for running Legends of Barsaive adventures as a campaign at your home table. In addition to the revised and expanded Haven Guidebook, this book collects the first eight Legends of Barsaive adventures: Toys in the Attic, Lip Service, Separation Anxiety, That Which Was Lost, Games of the Hungry, Glass Houses, Heavy Metal Queen, and Brain Scratch.

boardgame.name: Champions Challenge Volume 1: The Journey Begins
boardgame.description:
B'zhet was always different.

He never considered this a good thing. His k'stulaa flaps cause him problems, while training bouts with his sisters leave him battered, bruised, and feeling used. His uncle, Hull, says he was specially chosen, however B'zhet finds the old t'skrang's lessons leave him more frustrated then enlightened.

All that changes when an envoy arrives at his village and issues a challenge- one steeped in almost forgotten legends. While the elders stall for time, Hull presses his staff into B'zhet's hands and urges him to "Find Nymandus!"

With only those brief instructions, B'zhet finds himself outside the village's protective dome as it is activated for the first time in decades.
He is now faced with many questions: Who is Nymandus?

Where is Nymandus? How does any of this help save his village?

Why and for what was B'zhet chosen?

The Journey Begins...

boardgame.name: The Isle on Loch Greve
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Isle on Loch Greve is a self-contained adventure/encounter for the Mausritter roleplaying game, created for More Mausritter March 2021.

The locals have all been frightened away from the isolated island in the middle of Loch Greve - their fear the haunting sounds that now echo through the island are ghosts, or demons, or worse. Their origin is more mundane than magical though - a group of Toad Smugglers have taken up residence and are deliberately scaring others away.

boardgame.name: The Skeleton of Lord Whiskers
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The skeleton of Lord Whiskers is an adventure site by Lenorkia for the Mausritter roleplaying game, created for More Mausritter March 2021.

In the mouse kingom there is a place avoided by mice. The area where the great battle took place between mice and a cat lord Whiskers. His skeleton is the only thing that remained to remind everyone of the scary past. It's said even the bravest adventurers became frightened as soon as they see the skeleton of the huge and dreadful enemy of mousekind.

boardgame.name: The Hex of the Faerie Queen
boardgame.description:
From the description:

It looks like just a big meadow, but there is a hidden mouse and faerie settlement ruled by the faerie Queen. Lots of mouse go to this place, but strangely nobody is coming out...

This is a settlement location for your Mausritter campaing. It was inspired by the new Marvel series: Wandavision.

boardgame.name: Empty Thrones Personalities
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A set of 46 "personality cards". These accessories will feature the prominent (and maybe a few not-so-prominent) characters involved in the events of Empty Thrones. Printed on durable cardstock, they will feature a portrait of the character on one side, and a few key pieces of information about them on the other. Great for showing your players what the person they're dealing with looks like.

boardgame.name: The Dam at River's Bend
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Dam at River's Bend is a self-contained adventure/encounter for the Mausritter roleplaying game, created for More Mausritter March 2021.

At the bend in the river, just where the trees get thick, a family of beavers have built a tremendous dam of branches and mud and moss. In the very middle hides their den - a dark and mossy hollow, hiding sharp teeth, biting claws, and whatever shiny trinkets the beavers have discovered in their travels. There is no easy season to approach the den, but then, the journey is the best part of any adventure.

boardgame.name: Rotted Bridge
boardgame.description:
From the description:

During one of many journeys through the Duchy of the Ashen Lake, a group of brave mouse adventurers encountered an unexpected obstacle – the bridge, made of an old rotted tree that has fallen over the river, is now blocked by knights of lord Buckthorne. Turning back, unfortunately, is not an option.

This location and its short adventure utilizes Mausritter rules and setting created by Isaac Williams and is also heavily inspired by great content created by the game community. Despite that fact the adventure could be easily hacked and work with other OSR systems. The challenge and the difficulty level the adventure presents to the PCs is easily adjustable – stats for adversaries are intentionally not included.

boardgame.name: Tower of the Earless
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Basil the Earless is one of the most misterious figures in the Duchy of the Ashen Lake. Some say he’s a wizard and some say he’s a constructor. Others would argue that he’s the most capable and deranged alchemist the Duchy ever had. But soon enough all those drunkard’s rumours and coward’s gossips will be put to the test as a group of brave mice adventurers is about to enter the Tower of the Earless.

This location and its short adventure utilizes Mausritter rules and setting created by Isaac Williams. Inspiration for certain parts of this adventure comes from Ben Milton „The Alchemist’s Repose”, Michał Budziński „Sanktuarium Karmazynowych Konstruktorów” and lots of great content created by the Mausritter community. Despite being created with Mausritter in mind, the adventure could be easily hacked and work with other OSR systems. The challenge and the difficulty level the adventure presents to the PCs is easily adjustable – provided stats and quantities of adversaries are merely a suggestion to a GM.

boardgame.name: Maushex #2: The Volcanic Slippery Slope
boardgame.description:
From the description:

“The volcanic slippery slop ” is a Hex map to use with “Mausritter” or some other game where PCs are MICE!}
It's a weird and scorched place, there are fairies on the slopes and the ever changing Gyre keeps spitting rock and dirt into the air.

It contains the following

- 4 points of interest
- One of them is a dungeon with broad descriptions of three different levels!!
- Brief descriptions of such points, mostly adventure hooks.
- 1d6 encounters and..
- 1d6 rumors about the place

boardgame.name: Eyes of Empty Death
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Death lurks in the darkness! The deepest levels of the Abomination Vaults contain massive caverns and a relic left behind by one of the Outer Gods. The heroes must negotiate the ruthless politics of insular drow, vampiric urdefhands, and stranger creatures for the tools they need to vanquish Belcorra Haruvex. Yet even as the heroes grow nearer, the undead sorcerer's power increases, and the heroes must put her to rest before she claims the full might of her malevolent patron.

boardgame.name: The Fallen Eyrie
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A sparrowhawk has sieged the Order of sparrow riders and noble Sparrow Household and taken the old barn that used to protect the local area.

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Bestiary 3 (2nd Edition)
Pathfinder Monsterhandbuch 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
With more than 300 classic and brand-new monsters, this 320-page beautifully illustrated hardcover rulebook completes the collection of creatures begun in the first two Pathfinder Bestiary volumes. From classic creatures like clockworks and tooth fairies, returning favorites like imperial dragons and mighty titans, to brand-new menaces found all over Golarion, this must-have tome of monsters designed to challenge characters of any level is an essential companion to your Pathfinder game!

Pathfinder Bestiary 3 includes:

More than 300 monsters drawn from mythology and folklore, genre classics, and more than a decade of Pathfinder, with plenty of new monsters too!
Gorgeous full-color illustrations on nearly every page!
Comprehensive monster lists sorted by level, type, and rarity to help you find the right monster for any situation!
Universal monster rules to simplify special attacks, defenses, and qualities like grab, swallow whole, and regeneration.
Detailed lore sidebars offering additional information about even more of Pathfinder’s most popular friends and foes!

boardgame.name: Agents of Edgewatch Pawn Collection
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:
Enemies and allies from the Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path take their places on your tabletop with the Agents of Edgewatch Pawn Collection, featuring more than 100 pawns for use with Pathfinder Second Edition or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn presents a beautiful full-color image of a monster or NPC from the Agents of Edgewatch campaign, including city guards, monstrous criminals, aberrant horrors, and many other friends and foes!

The Agents of Edgewatch Pawn Collection, together with the creatures and characters from other Pathfinder Pawns collections, provides pawns for nearly every Agents of Edgewatch encounter. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder Bestiary Pawn Box or Pathfinder Pawns Base Assortment, making the pawns easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With tons of distinct images, the Agents of Edgewatch Pawn Collection brings to life the enemies and allies from all six volumes of the Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path.

The enemies and allies of the Agents of Edgewatch Adventure Path come to life on your tabletop! Each has its own abbreviation and identification number for easy sorting.

boardgame.name: New Phone, Who Dis: Family Edition
boardgame.description:
Players rotate drawing a sent (or “inbox”) card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest “reply” card. Once everyone has played their chosen reply card, the rotating judge awards a point to the funniest one. The player with the most points at the end of the round wins.

Includes: 240 family-friendly Inbox cards, 300 family-friendly Reply cards, and instructions.

boardgame.name: Tremble, Humans! Card Game: Spiel 2018 Promo cards
boardgame.description:
A set of four convention promo cards:

Essen - Reward: 5, Industrial Centre / Europe

Nuremberg - Reward: 5, Scientific Centre / Europe

Columbus - Reward: 5, Scientific Centre / North America

Indianapolis - Reward: 5, Cultural Centre / North America

boardgame.name: Republic of Jungle
boardgame.description:
The Republic of Jungle lets 5 to 10 players play politics as animals! You all work for President Puma, but a few of you are leaking information while the rest try to stop the leakers. Use your phone to communicate with the President and see the story unravel on the screen.

- Play anywhere. In a physical room, online video chat, or any streaming platform.
- Runs on your favorite platform. (We're starting with PC, but consoles and smart TVs are next.)
- No extra controllers needed. Jump in using a browser window. No Apps Required.
- Unique mechanics of secrecy and deception that are only possible because each player has a private screen.
- Built for streaming. Features that bring the audience into the game and make them part of the fun.
- Narrated tutorial and guided experience. New players feel welcome to jump in and learn as they go.
- Animals doing politics!

boardgame.name: Grabbelbox
boardgame.description:
A chaotic tactical family game. 2 to 4 players do not try to throw their pieces into the box, as they end up getting them out of it again under difficult conditions.

The game is played in 3 rounds of 2 phases.

Each player picks stones of a single color. In the first phase, players stand around the box and try to throw everyone else's stones in the box. This phase ends when all the stones of one player/color are in the box. Players get a point for each of their stones in the box.

At the start of the second phase, someone chooses a handicap card and everybody tries to pick their stones out of the box with this handicap at the same time. This round ends when one person has removed all their stones from the box. All the other players get 1 point per stone left in the box.

After 3 rounds, the game ends and the winner is the player with the least total points.

boardgame.name: KFC's Travel Game
boardgame.description:
The game contains card with luggage items printed on them.

Players draw cards and try to name the items depicted in the order in which they were drawn. When a player makes a mistake, they're out of the game and have lost. The last player who's still in the game, when all other players have lost, is the winner.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

3 Cards with the rules, in Dutch, English and French.
6 Cards with items, with the background color begin yellow.
6 Cards with items, with the background color being orange.
6 Cards with items, with the background color being blue-ish.
5 Cards with items, with the background color being red.
5 Cards with items, with the background color being purple.
5 Cards with items, with the background color being green.


Although there are 6 different colors, the rules do not indicate that they are to be used differently or have different value compared to others colors.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

boardgame.name: KFC's Color Addict
boardgame.description:
The game contains cards with the names of colors printed on them. Each named color is printed in 5 colors (all that are also named) and two jokers. The cards are dealt evenly to all players, with each player holding 3 cards in hard, the rest as a drawing stack.

The purpose of the game is to get rid of your own cards first, including your own draw pile. To do this, when it's your turn, you try to match one of your hand cards with the color or word of the last played card. If you can't match, you draw a card from your own draw pile.

The dealer plays the top card from their draw pile as the first card to match.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

1 card with the rules.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Blue'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Green'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Yellow'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Orange'.
7 cards, in 5 colors + 2 jokers, with the word 'Red'.


Each word is printed in the colors blue, green, yellow, orange and red once and two cards have a mix of the colors, indicating them as joker cards.

This game resembles Crazy Eights / UNO, but without the "take that" cards.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

boardgame.name: KFC's 4 op een rij
boardgame.description:
The game contains card in two colors, each color has 4 creatures printed on them, the same creatures for each color. Both colors have 24 cards, each creature has 6 cards in both colors. There are 48 players card, 6 advanced assignments cards and 1 rule card, making a total of 55 cards.

Players pick one of either color (blue or red) and take all cards in that color and shuffle them up. They then take turns playing a card, adding it to the set, either horizontally or vertically, but not diagonally. Their goal is to make a set of 4 cards, either horizontally, vertically or diagonally, of their own color. The type of monster is not important, only that it's your color. This can also be played to get 4 in a row, with the rules unchanged otherwise.

There is an advanced version of the game, this uses the 6 advanced assignment cards, where you have to place your monsters in a specific shape to win. This also includes a "X * monster" card, which means you only win if you get 4 monster (or 5 in the 5-in-a-row variant) in the same row.

This game resembles a paper version of a 4/5-in-a-row type Tic-Tac-Toe game.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

boardgame.name: KFC's Assano
boardgame.description:
The game contains cards with numbers and 'actions' printed on them, in several colors plus a few jokers.

The purpose of the game is to get rid of your own hand cards first. To do this, when it's your turn, you try to match on of your own cards with the color or symbol of the last played card. Jokers are always valid to play, if you have them. If you can't match, you draw a card from a shared draw pile. If you can match that card, you can instantly play it.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

3 Cards with the rules, in Dutch, English and French.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color yellow.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color blue.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color green.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color red.
5 Card with additional actions, 2 "take-2" cards, 3 "change color" card, in the color black.


This game resembles Crazy Eights / UNO, but with some the "take that" cards, but not all.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wyrd: The Darkness
boardgame.description:
The Darkness is the first expansion for Wyrd: The Descent.

Emerge from the Hollows, beaten and weary only to Descend again and again, for the World of The Living is ever threatened by The Darkness that surrounds it.

But be careful, the Horrors are not the only threat. Demons claw their way into reality, and will take Possession of you should you delve too deep.

For you are not Wyrd yet.

In The Darkness you will attempt to link your games of Wyrd: The Descent together by developing your Wyrd and avoiding the risk of Possession.

This is the full colour rulebook for The Darkness updated to 2.15 including an updated FAQ, clarifications to the Laws of Possession with examples and the Sigils for the modular PnP Hollows tiles in the reference section. There are also two play sheets to print out to draw your Hollows on, with and without a grid.

You will need a copy of Wyrd: The Descent 1.2+, a set of RPG polyhedral dice and a pen and some paper to play.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Solacebound
boardgame.description:
Young monsters played at the boundary between the worlds. They slipped and stranded in a human city. Isolated and unwelcome, they search for each others help and a way back.

Solacebound is a GM-less Game for 3-5 people to play over a few hours. Search a sprawling, oppressive city for your friends, find out who is willing to give you a roof, bash back against authorities, cook together and console each other. Will you find a way back home before all passages close?

Content Warning: Structural Oppression and Violence

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: クローバーブーケ (Clover Bouquet)
boardgame.description:
For two people. Draw one card from the opponent player's hand with the same contents, add one card from your own hand and compare the size of the total number, but only when 4 is mixed, the strength of big and small is reversed. It's a rule.

A model for reading games. It's okay to read each other like this! It's strong to be able to count, but there is also a moderate amount of luck. With the information of the drawn cards drawn by each other, I wonder how to deal with the hand. It solves the problem that if you are completely lucky, it is just gambling, and if it is abstract, the one who is accustomed to the game tends to be unilaterally beaten / beaten.

二人用。中身一緒の相手プレイヤーの手札から1枚を引き、自分の手札から一枚を追加して合計数の大きさ比べをしますが、4が混じった場合のみ、大小の強弱が逆転、というシンプルなルールです。

　読み合いゲームのお手本。読み合いはこういうのでいいんだよこういうので！　カウンティング出来ると強いけど、引き運の部分もほどほどにある。お互いに引いた引かれたカードの情報がある中で、手札とどうやりくりするかを悩む。完全に運だとただのギャンブルだし、アブストラクトだとどちらかゲーム慣れしている方が一方的に殴る/殴られるゲームになりがちなのをうまく解決しています。

listing.notes:
Opened for photos
Stored in Temperature-controlled game storage room since acquisition Dedicated shelf space -- not stacked No smoking house, etc. and our games are handled and packed carefully
Discount shipping will be calculated based on actual location.

boardgame.name: トウキョウのハト エサバ・バトル (Tokyo Doves)
boardgame.description:
Enclose with pigeons! A game in which pigeons over the hamburger's food are mixed up.

You will receive 6 pigeon cards of each color. Take out the boss pigeon and place it in the middle.

Alternately "issue cards" or "move cards" from the first player.

To "put out", select one pigeon card you have and place it so that it touches your pigeon card in the field with "sides" or "corners". However, it cannot be placed in a place where it touches the opponent's boss.

In the case of "move", move your pigeon card so that it touches your or your opponent's pigeon card with "sides" or "corners". After moving, you can touch the opponent's boss by "side".

If you repeat your turn alternately, the number of pigeon cards in the field will increase and spread. However, there is a limit to the "size" of this game. The size of the card that can be placed is "vertical and horizontal, only for 4 pigeon cards". Places larger than the size are treated as "walls" and cards cannot be taken out or moved.

The victory or defeat will be won if the opponent's boss pigeon's vertical and horizontal 4 squares are surrounded by "hatto cards" and "walls". The pigeon card does not have to be your own pigeon card, so make good use of the opponent's pigeon card and wall to enclose the boss pigeon!

ハトで囲み込め！ハンバーガーのエサバをめぐるハトが入り乱れるゲーム。

それぞれの色のハトカードを6枚ずつ受け取ります。ボスハトを取り出し、真ん中に配置します。

最初のプレイヤーから交互に「カードを出す」か「カードの移動」をします。

「出す」場合は、手持ちのハトカードを1枚選び、場に置いていある自分のハトカードに「辺」か「角」で接するように配置します。ただし、相手のボスに辺で接する場所には出せません。

「移動」の場合は、自分のハトカードを、自分か相手のハトカードに「辺」か「角」で接するように動かします。移動後なら、相手のボスに「辺」で接することができます。

交互に手番を繰り返していくと、場のハトカードが増えて広がっていきます。ただ、このゲームには「広さ」に制限があります。カードを配置できる広さは「タテヨコ、ハトカード4枚分だけ」です。広さ以上の場所は「壁」扱いとなり、カードを出すことも移動もできません。

勝敗は、相手のボスハトの、タテヨコ4マスを「ハトカード」や「壁」で囲ったら勝ちとなります。ハトカードは自分のハトカードでなくてもOKですので、相手のハトカードや壁もうまく利用してボスハトを囲い込みましょう！

boardgame.name: Biblios: Quill and Parchment – Chapel Cards
boardgame.description:
Use your abbot influence to choose tasks and earn more piety points with this 8-card pack.

Introduces Step 4: Compline where players bid on how much influence they would spend to gain the chapel card's benefit.

—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: The Forges of Toaster
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Here is a quick 6-mile hex made for the Rittermarch Game Jam and the Pleasure-not-Business Card RPG Jam. It comes with 3 unique locations and factions, a d6 "Goings On" table, and 3 custom items. Have fun!

boardgame.name: Catsfall
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Welcome to the mighty city of Catsfall, home to one of the biggest historical battles against catkind. The now peaceful city is once again threatened, and might need our brave mouse adventurers to defend it while it is besieged...

boardgame.name: A Paw Full of Magic
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This zini contains a dozen special items for your Mausritter game.

boardgame.name: Butterfly Garden (Second Edition): Endangered Species
boardgame.description:
Save endangered species to score more VPs! This 10-card pack includes 2 variants.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mathematicus: Il gioco della matematica
boardgame.description:
Mathematicus is used in three different modes: basic, normal and advanced.
The board is the same, but different elements are used in each mode such as specific dice, tokens, cards and tools.
The game in basic mode has simplified rules compared to the other two modes.
Another interesting aspect of Mathematicus is that it can be played simultaneously in different modes by different players, each of which answers questions suited to his level of knowledge.

in basic mode Mathematicus has the structure of a "goose game", that is, dice are rolled and progressed along a path made of spaces, in each of which one is called to carry out certain actions or have benefits or penalties. In Mathematicus two different dice are used, the tetrahedral die (4 faces) and the dodecahedral die (12 faces), leaving the player to choose from time to time which one to use.

You advance along the path by answering the questions (of the level chosen) posed by the cards. Questions must be answered within the indicated times.

Goal of the game: to collect as many figures of famous mathematicians as possible, even taking them away from other players, (using the "Fields Medal" or event card) but you cannot have two figures of the same mathematician.

In advanced mode the game allows you to become familiar with ancient calculation tools (Napier's Sticks and the Calculator Rule), with interesting numbering systems used by various civilizations of the past, and also with binary calculation, essential in the current world of electronics and information technology.

Extracted translation from the rulebook

boardgame.name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Gabriel
boardgame.description:
This is a promotional survivor figure from the Zombicide 2nd edition Kickstarter

A man of action, Gabriel grew from a rank-and-file policeman to a respected anti-drug cop. Fighting zombies well before the real zombies came, he designed a very efficient intervention method to deal with drug-laced thugs in close-quarters. A zombie tide destroyed the society he was fighting for and soon made him a legend among survivors: a wise gunslinger willing to help anyone meeting him with a good cause to fight for.

listing.notes: will use Registered Package with tracking https://www.singpost.com/send-receive/send-overseas

GABRIEL - KICKSTARTER PROMO - ENGLISH
NEW IN SHRINK - never opened!
INCLUDES: - Miniature - Survivor card - Replacement box
Feel free to PM me with any questions or if you are interested and would like to receive further pictures!
Payment via Bank Transfer or PayPal. If you cannot or do not wish to pay with the option "Sending to a friend or family", than please pay an additional 4%.
Will ship same/next day after payment received (according to the time zone!)

boardgame.name: Castles & Crusades Flip Book (2018)
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

This is a softcover printing that includes both the Castles & Crusades Players Handbook (7th printing) and the Adventurers Backpack (1st printing). The book is printed such that if you are reading one of the titles and flip the book over, you will now be able to read the other title.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: 2018 Flip Book with 7th ed Players Handbook and 1st ed Adventurers Backpack

boardgame.name: La Fête des Vignerons, le jeu
boardgame.description:
In "La Fête des Vignerons, le jeu", you play as gods who control (with varying degrees of success) the weather.

Helping each one a winegrower from the region, and for the good of the grapes and the wine, you will try to manage the elements.

Your objective: to protect you from the elements by guiding them to your opponents in order to guarantee you a great wine-growing year.

The player with the most saved vineyard at the end of the game wins!

boardgame.name: Smash The System
boardgame.description:
SMASH THE SYSTEM is a game where you play as characters who sneak into the domain of the corporate oligarchs, discover conspiracies, sabotage the machinery, steal files, and eventually bring the whole thing crashing down.

You also stack dice carefully before smacking them around your room.

To Play, you will need:

These rules
Some pencils and lined paper
A stopwatch / stopwatch app (or you can ignore the rule that requires this)
As many 6-sided dice as you can scrounge up

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Stand Up
boardgame.description:
Things can change.
You just have to stand up and fight for it.




The Game

Stand Up is a Belonging Outside Belonging game about rebellion, forming bonds, fighting injustice, and changing the world.

Take on the roles of normal people with the capability to become heroes, explore a fantastical world that houses mankind’s inner feelings, and find a way to fight back using power only you can wield.



Materials


3-7 players
a pool of tokens (coins, dice, poker chips, etc.)
something to write with
a printout of the playkit (a map, 7 playbooks, 4 setting elements)




Inspiration

Stand Up is inspired by the Persona series of games by Atlus Co. Ltd..

The games hold a special place in my heart not only for their amazing stories and characters, but also for the themes of rebellion, acceptance, and fighting for what you believe in. This game is my love letter to those themes and Persona as a whole.

However, you don't need to know anything about Persona to play Stand Up. The game includes explanations of the basic setting and premise, but players are free and encouraged to bring their own interpretations of the world of Stand Up into their sessions.



Playbooks

Each playbook is based on a different archetype shown in the games, helpfully symbolized by cards in the Major Arcana. There are seven playbooks, each with their own focus and themes.


The Fool focuses on reaching out a helping hand.
Based on the Persona protagonists.




The Magician focuses on inspiring change in the world.
Based on Morgana, INVALID OBJECT ID=8881, type=thing, and Junpei Iori.




The Chariot focuses on never compromising their beliefs.
Based on N/A and INVALID OBJECT ID=8880, type=thing.




The Lovers focuses on making others stronger through support.
Based on INVALID OBJECT ID=46312, type=thing, Soviet Combat Vehicle Handbook, and Yukari Takeba.




The Emperor focuses on learning and teaching acceptance.
Based on Necessary Evil Explorer's Edition, INVALID OBJECT ID=8882, type=thing, and Akihiko Sanada.




The Priestess focuses on breaking free of expectations.
Based on The Palladium RPG Book V: "Further" Adventures in the Northern Wilderness, INVALID OBJECT ID=8883, type=thing, and Fuuka Yamagishi.




The Empress focuses on standing tall despite hardship.
Based on The Iron Wind (2nd Edition) and Mitsuru Kirijo.





Content Warnings.

Embedded: systemic violence and abuse of power
Potential: physical and psychological violence, abuse, exploitation and manipulation, etc.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Stand Up Playkit
boardgame.description:
The Printable Playkit includes:

1 page to create your game map
7 playbooks
4 setting elements

boardgame.name: The Halls of Death and Dreamers
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

"Just outside of Louisville, Kentucky there is an old hotel with a troubling secret. Guests regularly check in for the evening, but far fewer check out in the morning. From the outside, it looks like a normal luxury hotel with a detached convention center situated nearby. The rooms are clean and well appointed, one beside the other down a very long hall. While the sun is shining, it's business as usual; travellers [sic] come and go, maids make the beds, and kids splash around in an enormous pool. But woe betide the guest who leaves their room in the middle of the night. The warning on the back of the door, right above the fire escape map, reads: 'Please remain in room after midnight. Do not unlock your doors!' But what are you supposed to do when you wake up and your companion has gone missing?"

This is a kickstarter exclusive for Purgatory House based on a real-life hotel with a disturbing floor plan. Characters should be travelers who have stopped for the night, each with a traveling companion.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Trek to the Spire
boardgame.description:
Veil sensors have located a source of significant interference on the planet below. Strong likelihood of Ruin, Windswept, and Surge presence, but initial forays indicate sizeable dimensional disturbances as well. A Spire, standing at the coast, seems to be the source of these distortions. Get to the Spire, take readings, and then get back safely, Beacons!


LIGHT: Trek to the Spire combines a strike format with an overworld exploration zone that features several feuding factions while also introducing a brand new enemy type: the geometrically-perfect and cosmically-horrible Numinitous!

Trek to the Spire also offers three new gear tags and three new Legendary weapons.

Furthermore, mutant fungi have corrupted the woods near the Spire and the spores seem to feed on both Light and Dark. There might be further fungal developments as they assimilate the nearby flora and fauna.

Finally, place your own strikes onto the map to keep the Light shining! Plan a foray to the heart of the Cube! What lies beyond the Hypercube's portals? And what will befall the mutated Windswept feeding on mushrooms in place of Aether?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Halloween Party: Memento Mori
boardgame.description:
Expansion to Hallowen Party (2019)

Halloween Party: Memento Mori includes:

-2 (3 via KS Stretch Goals) additional playable characters w/ associated reference cards (1 per character, with 1 in Spanish and 1 in English translation...6 total)
-10 Minor Spell Cards
-2 Major Spell Cards
-18 new Creature Cards (+3 additional from KS Stretch Goals)
-15 Ritual Cards
-3 Halloween Pet Cards (via KS stretch goals)
-12 reference cards (6 in Spanish, 6 in English translation)
-1 rulesheet (1 side in Spanish, 1 side in English translation)

boardgame.name: Dire Hunter
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Forever the hunter, never the prey. Your upbringing failed you, leaving you to learn quick to survive in the Dying World. Raised amongst beasts and wildkin within the wilderness, starved amongst a sea of sand and cragged rocks for a lifetime. You wear the corpse of the creature that stalked your childhood as a grim memento.

An optional character class for MÖRK BORG.

boardgame.name: Gila RPGs Necropack
boardgame.description:
This is the Gila RPGs Necropack! Three supplements for some of my previous RPGs, injecting them with a little life through the power of necromancy.

House Graves is a Seasons supplement, bringing a new House for the players to come from. House Graves oversees the complicated process of dealing with Fey death, and they do so with style.

The Necrothief is a new class for Score! Have you ever wondered what it would be like to rob a bank with a necromancer on your side? Wonder no more!

The Thanatonaut is a new optional class for LIGHT. These Beacons dance with death, and bring new Powers, and their own Tag, Cast, and Armor.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Abominable Bone Pit of Alteraxx
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Centuries ago the bone-sculptor Alteraxx stalked the land with his dread Danse Macabre collecting materials to perfect his craft. When his mortal body withered and languished, his spirit remained amongst the debris of a thousand skeletal minions. With time, this unholy site coalesced into the Abominable Bone Pit, a phenomenon that appears throughout the lands seemingly at random but with singular purpose - to swell the ever-growing pile of material needed to fuel its unending tide of cursed creations.

A monster generator for MÖRK BORG spawning terrible abominations into the dying world, over 300 different variations!

boardgame.name: Omentide
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Countless decades ago, the great Demon Koyn’nach wandered the land in search of power. A malevolent being of trickery and deceit, it would draw mortals into its influence by granting them gifts, highly-prized egg-like objects; but these treasures would only be seen for one fateful week during the year; the Omentide.

An egg hunt riddled with danger and reward!

boardgame.name: The Sunken Tome
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A collection of 17 spells to unleash in MÖRK BORG!

boardgame.name: Blighted Merman
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You are a creature of the ocean, no longer a wretched landlubber. Dragged into the Endless Sea by curse or witchery and spat out a twisted form, changed forever. What is left of your humanity is perverted by the tides and the salt-soaked waters that you now call your home.

An optional character class for MÖRK BORG, featuring a grim past among the waves and a troubled future as a mutated terror.

boardgame.name: Festival of the Damned
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

"Uncle Eddie's Fun Park & 'Festival of the Damned' is an aging and run down amusement park outside of Reno, NV. Once a bustling roadside attraction on the way westward to Sacramento, it has become a destination mostly visited by those seeking to reclaim the lost nostalgia of their childhood. Tonight is high school graduation, and a group of seniors have broken in after hours for a bit of mischief. What nobody realizes is that the Fun Park has also been chosen by a group of insane cultists intent on raising their terrible god from the desert sands. With the perfect scenery for dark rites and a fresh supply of young sacrifices, this really could be the beginning of an unholy end."

This Travel Brochure scenario takes the basic premise of Purgatory House and twists it to a unique outside location. Replacement Room and Obstacle charts are included, along with descriptions and special rules where needed, though the main rule book is still required to play. Will you survive these thrilling rides?

boardgame.name: Beaver Tower
비버 타워
boardgame.description:
There are vigorous beavers in the mountain valley.
We need to make a cool and vertiginous tower for beavers to play at. Build a tower they want and bring as many as possible to the tower!

Use only the hands and fingers presented on the construction rule card to build the tower shown on the tower card. When you finished building the tower, you have to put the beavers on it. You will earn additional points for the number of beavers you put on your tower. After the 6th round, the player with the highest score wins.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Mining Colony: Objectives Pack
boardgame.description:
Race to create objectives before your opponents with this 10-card pack.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Nanga Parbat: Hidden Objectives
boardgame.description:
Score bonus points at game end by completing secret objectives with this 7-card pack.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Spring On Me
boardgame.description:
It is Spring, and that means chaos, being messy and being awkward.



Spring On Me is a prompt-based rpg about messy dates, funny surprises, and being together. In it, you will play characters who are intertwined, awkward and connected as they meet and date in Spring. But time is short, so what will you say to each other before the season's gone?

Spring On Me comes in a soft, pink 6-paged booklet PDF for ease of use and print - cover included. Make a mess out of your love and romance anytime, anywhere! In it, you'll find:


Easy-to-follow rules for character creation in just a few minutes! Make yourself as messy as you want, and make up the relationships you have with each other.
An easy-to-play, prompt-based game to create stories about cute and adorable encounters together. Improvise awkward situations and fumble against each other with complications.
Rules for your final date with each other. Choose your words wisely before you the next season comes upon you.
All accompanied by tiny notes and rules for roleplaying aid and how to have a fun session. Spring On Me is written with consensual, fun and safe romance in mind - and that goes for your players as well!



'Spring On Me was made to celebrate Valentine's Day 2020 - that and all the love we experience or yearn for every day. This game is dedicated to the LGBTQIA+ community - permanently and indefinitely. Love strongly, love carefully, love freely.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Employee Handbook For Newly Appointed Spellchitects
boardgame.description:
You are all contract Spell Architects - Spellchitects - for your city.


Congratulations!


You craft and design the spells and rituals that are being cast all around your world. Using your advanced knowledge of how magic is weaved, you mark out the symbols, colors, and components to craft the desired effects.

Sometimes you make spells for customers, sometimes you make spells just for the heck of it! As Spellchitects, it’s all about experimentation, collaboration, and fun!

Spellchitects is a quick collaborative experience for players to make weird and crazy spells and perform them in fun ways. Play it for as many rounds as you want and come up with unique ways to be a Spellchitect!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dinosorcerer
boardgame.description:
The Dinosorcerer is a new class for use with Slayers. A copy of that game is required to use it. Dinosorcerer was made for the Spring From the Graves Jam.

The Dinosorcerer summons dinosaurs from beneath the City and wraps themselves in their bones. It consumes their essence like marrow, growing stronger with the spirit of the dinosaur. Mechanically, they are incredibly versatile, able to augment a simple attack with a variety of dinosaur forms. The Dinosorcerer can act as support, tank, or damage dealer. It won't be as effective as a dedicated class for any role, but can switch between them easily.

The Dinosorcerer summons the bones and spirits of long-dead dinosaurs from beneath the City and consumes their essence, stealing the power of these magnificent reptiles for themselves. They surround themselves in the fossils of dinosaurs and siphon the dinosaur spirit like marrow. The only reason it’s not illegal is because no one is brave enough to pass the first law against it.

As the Dinosorcerer, you can activate the bones of dinosaurs, gaining different benefits based on the dinosaur's abilities. Siphon the speed of a velociraptor, the sturdiness of an ankylosaurus, the charging power of a triceratops, or the BRUTE FORCE of the mighty T-Rex.

NOTE: Also includes Bonus Tactician Advance
Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: After School Adventure: The Game
boardgame.description:
After School Adventure is a go anywhere adventure game where players bypass difficult encounters and obtain wondrous treasures. ASA has 4 unique adventured players can embark on. Each adventure has its own unique challenges. The adventures include; The Old Mansion, The Spooky Forest, The carnival and The Caverns.
Adventurers start with a specific set of skills. Skills help determine the ability of adventures to bypass encounters. Skills can be enhanced or hindered by treasure object obtain throughout each adventure. All skills accumulate from adventure to adventure. Each players skills change depending on the treasure objects found. Players can obtain special trinkets that can aid then throughout the adventures.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fossil Canyon
boardgame.description:
Fossil Canyon is a competitive, lightly-strategic set-collection card game developed in collaboration with the Field Museum of Chicago. You are a fossil-hunting paleontologist with the goal of constructing complete dinosaur skeletons that attract visitors to your museum. Each dinosaur skeleton has a different point value (represented as visitors per year) and may consist of two, three, or four unique fossils.

On each turn, you dig fossils from the dig site (scattered face-down fossil cards), initiate trades with other players, take a bonus dig if you manage to complete a skeleton for your museum, and rearrange your fossil cards so that all but three are visible to other players. Strategic choices include deciding which fossils to expose and the number of increasingly expensive trades you perform to try to complete a skeleton. Random events, such as erosion, may force you to alter your strategy.

Fossil Canyon uses a unique jigsaw-puzzle scoring method, where each skeleton you add to your museum is represented by a puzzle piece with a length proportional to its value. No adding victory points or moving pawns on a board; the length of your puzzle-museum indicates your standing in the game.

Fossil Canyon is a family-oriented STEM game. Adults will appreciate the beautifully-illustrated cards and the unique set-collection mechanics that make Fossil Canyon a fast-playing, lightly-strategic game. Children will love the dinosaur theme and the tactile jigsaw puzzle scoring, turning the game into a race.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo: Monster Box
Повелитель Токио: Монстр бокс
boardgame.description:
The whole King of Tokyo shebang in one Monster Box.
The fight for dominating the city of Tokyo has never been so competitive! This explosive Monster Box is filled with fun and adrenaline! Get King of Tokyo and all of its indispensable Power Up! and Halloween expansions for hours and hours of smashes. Use your Monster's Evolution Cards to get even more special properties, and dress them up for even more fun! The Monster Box also comes with a brand new version of Gigazaur, exclusive cards and a new dice tray, some much needed bonuses to destroy Tokyo in style!
With the Monster Box awesome content, smash like never before!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Festival Guru
boardgame.description:
Festival Guru is a board game developed by festival organizers and Spieltrieb.

Players need to catch 6 live performances within 4 different stages in one festival day. We all know it's easier said than done. Pack up your festival bag and get ready for a muddy, crazy, chilled, rowdy and epic adventure!

Get through an unpredictable action-packed festival day while you try and catch all your favorite bands live. This game now includes 24 independent bands from across the globe that you can watch, via a QR-Code, at the end of every round.

In a festival, one prefers to be with friends when watching bands live or having drinks at the beer stands. Hence, players get more chances to earn Fun Points when they meet friends or other rockers in the game. As you advance across the festival ground, one should take other player's movements into account.

The one who gained the most Fun Points on the Fun Barometer, at the end of the game, is the winner.

boardgame.name: Age of Dogfights WWI: Main Expansion
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Age of Dogfights contains rules and scenarios for airships, observation ballons, barrage ballons, anti-aircraft guns and 27 new types of aircraft from 6 countries.
With it you can find out if it isd feasible to attack with fast Italian planes on targets in the Austro-Hungarian background that is sheltered by barrage balloons and defended with strong anti-aircraft fire. Do the large and slow Russian bombers have a chance against German fighters? What will happen when a mixed French-Serbian squadron returns from a task with low ammunition and encounters a strong Bulgarian patrol?

There are a total of 10 scenarios in the brochure enabling you to ne immersed into the role of a squadron leader on an important task.

boardgame.name: Family Feud (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
No one knows how the feud started between two of the largest families in Carcassonne. Some say it was a boundary dispute, others say it was due to a cow. No one knows for certain. But the one certain thing is that the two families will have nothing to do with each other and will go out of their way to keep their distance from each other.

New tiles with pennants of a new family.

Bezahlt werden kann per paypal, Vorauskasse, Bankeinzug oder direkt bei uns im Laden (wenn ihr aus Berlin kommt).
Wenn ihr noch irgendwelche Fragen habt, ruft uns an (030 79706126), schickt uns ne Mail (laden@gamers-hq.de) oder besucht unsere Homepage (www.gamers-hq.de).
Unsere AGB findet ihr hier : https://gamers-hq.de/agb

If this listing is still up, it is still available! Feel free to ask questions/pictures.
New, still wrapped in shrink.
Exact shipping fee is to be determined by Canada Post/FedEx/UPS/DHL or your international courier of choice. Alternatively, free pickup in the Greater Montreal region.
Canadian buyers can also use Interac e-Transfer or Wealthsimple Cash for payment.

boardgame.name: Flick of Faith: Apokaschnipse – Cthulhu God Promo
Flick of Faith: Cthulhu God Promo
Palec Boży: Cthulhu – karta promo
boardgame.description:
Cthulhu God is very powerful in the game and brings a lot of options for its owner. Maybe this mighty Great Old One doesn’t bring additional victory points to the game, but his ability opens space for many controversial moves.

Cthulhu may use other player Prophets for an additional flick after the Mission Phase ends. You may use it to flick somebody out from the map, or to move your Prophet to any Island.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Old School & Cool (Vol. 2 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Created especially for Zinequest3, Old School and Cool Vol 2 is a laser-focused setting/sourcebook/style guide for Old School Essentials. It's Mad Max and Planet of the Apes and Rifts but also compatible with Scourge of the Scorn Lords or other end-of-the-world settings.

Inside this 'zine are 40 pages of skull-crushing old school awesomeness!

New Sci-Fi Classes. Think you can survive a post-apoc hellscape? Maybe you can, if you play as one of our Mutant Apes, Mech Masters, or Wasteland Warriors.
Awesome Vehicles! Killer bikes, wasteland contraptions, Pontiac Firebird Trans Ams, modded hot-rods, sspider-mechs, and more!
Psychic Combat Rules! The ultimate battle is a battle of the mind.
Vehicle Combat and Chase rules.
SF Equipment: All the Lasers and gas masks and vibro blades you'd hope for.
NPC generators to create thousands of apropriate characters on the fly.
A Mini-Adventure in the Far Future! Packed with surprises and a totally rad map!

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #5 - Apr 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magic items like the ring of truth, rod of the moon, dryad's wreath, and white peacock crown!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like flood tide, colossus, dagger of deception, and dirge of the victorious knights!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the Norn and Nereid Sorcerer and Unicorn Charger!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the ioun wyrd, gold golem, and the titanic kaiju King Mogaru!

boardgame.name: The Sunken Library
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drowned in Knowledge

Set immediately following Catacombs of Living Death, the heroes flee a plague-ridden landscape while being beset by many foes throughout the journey.

The plans of their seemingly addled patron Jok Sevantes reach their fateful conclusion. His partners must bring all of their previously acquired (looted and pillaged) artifacts to a secret location to effect a final ritual, under the waters of a lake in far-off Nran.

There, searching for a supposedly lost book in the sunken Great Library of Hrel matters become treacherously clear.

The Sunken Library is designed for 4–6 characters of 36–38 points. It is the epic conclusion to a series of five adventures featuring the arcane archaeologist Jok C. Sevantes.

boardgame.name: The Catacombs of Living Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Red Plague has come to Athan.

Following the events of Roc of Sages, the always acquisitive Jok Sevantes again calls stalwart adventurers to aid him in his efforts to find and recover valuable arcane artifacts.

This time, they must venture forth and travel through a plague-stricken land. Surviving the journey, the heroes must enter the Catacombs of Eulogia and recover the powerful Helm of Baat.

Simple enough…but things are not always as they appear. Nothing that powerful sits unguarded and unwatched: The present owners are certain to object strenuously.

Catacombs of Living Death is for 4–6 characters of 36–38 points. While designed to follow Crown of Eternity, Curse of the Pirate King, and Roc of Sages, it can be played by itself with some adjustment.

boardgame.name: Roc of Sages
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The semi-corporeal arcane archaeologist Jok Sevantes is at it again.

This time, he claims to need certain cast-offs from the legendary Viridian Rocs, giant creatures not known for their gentle disposition.

Beset by League assassins, known as Collectors, the party must once again brave a desolate wasteland to recover the objects, and when the scatterbrained Sevantes does the planning…things never work out as intended.

Roc of Sages is designed for 4–6 characters of 34 to 36 points. It is intended to follow the events of Crown of Eternity and Curse of the Pirate King, but contains advice in case you want to start a campaign with this volume.

The last page of the adventure contains 42 print-your own counters for monsters and NPCs that appear in the adventure (in black-and-white).

boardgame.name: Dark Lord's Doom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Another Dark Lord is on the rise, threatening to bring death and destruction to all who oppose him…and maybe a few who don’t. Saethor’s Dark Legion was hired to keep order in a time of famine, betrayed and massacred the council that hired him, and seized power. With a name like “the Dark Legion,” could one really expect it to end any differently? He assimilated the Red Fang orcs and defeated the elves of Amberwood. Now, his avaricious gaze turns on the Kingdom…

This solo/programmed adventure features a squad of soldiers fighting in an all-out war to defeat the evil Lord before it’s too late. Will the Dark Lord’s Doom fall upon the party, or on the villain himself?

boardgame.name: Dragon Hunt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scaly Problems are popping up all over.

Baron Gwalathar’s armies marched off to war; the dragons of the wild sensed weakness, ravaging the realm. The young Baroness Tanith calls for heroes: It’s time for a dragon hunt!

Dragon Hunt is a programmed adventure for two or three 37–39 point characters. It would take a truly mighty-thewed hero to tackle the dragons alone!

So many dragons.

This adventure is for use with Steve Jackson Games’ The Fantasy Trip – In the Labyrinth. It is a solo/programmed adventure that you can play by yourself, or with a group with or without a GM.

boardgame.name: Nordlondr Folk
Norðlondr Fólk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside Norðlondr Fólk, find a whole new world of playable races for your character!

16 templates to supplement and enhance those from Dungeon Fantasy Adventurers.
Alternate versions of elves, dwarves, and other races specific to the Norðlond cosmology.
Honor your gods: Take on the visage and abilities of their totem animal.
Become one of the many hybrid races walking Nordlond: the half-demon eldhuð, dragon-blooded, and more.

boardgame.name: Guns of the Frontier Vol. 7
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first rule of survival in The Frontier is to never leave home without your trusty pistol, rifle or rocket launcher. And bring a grenade or two just in case.

This sourcebook for The Frontier, the shoot-and-loot sci-fi roleplaying game, introduces 8 new weapons and armor...

Amber Moon (rare battle armor): The universe doesn’t revolve around you but sometimes it’s nice to pretend otherwise.

Bloodbath (exotic combat shotgun): Each shell rips through flesh and contains nanobots that harvest nutrients and transfer them to worthier people, such as you and your friends. Best of all: you don’t need to worry what’s the blood type of that unlucky bandit at the other end of the barrel. Everybody is a universal donor!

Blue Thunder (uncommon autoloader): This handy pistol is equipped with a built-in wireless taser for non-lethal takedowns. You can also do pretty lethal takedowns by shooting them repeatedly while they’re shocked. Take some time afterwards to ponder the morality of this.

Holoclone (exotic recon armor): Every VIP knows that having a double is a great protection. With this armor, you can go two better.

Alcatraz (legendary combat shotgun): After careful analysis you’ve managed to identify the main problem with your targets: they keep moving! The patented energy restraint system on this shotgun offers the solution.

Overseer (legendary battle rifle): It’s like having your own personal drone, only this one is not for taking pictures.

Scalpel (rare combat shotgun): Load up with Shredder™ ammo to surgically excise the opposition.

Trapper Joe (uncommon pump shotgun): This shotty has a built-in launcher for when you have to bring them in alive rather than dead.

boardgame.name: Camp Cairn (Black Spear)
Marchlands Pocket Adventures Volume 7: Camp Cairn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bandits that must be stopped. A community that wishes not to punish them, but to save them from themselves. A hillside fort, and a bandit ringleader hellbent with his hand on the switch to blow it all to the heavens.

Camp Cairn calls for players to fight and subdue bandits without killing them, and without giving a maniac an excuse to bring a fiery end to the whole operation. Lives are on the line, and no small amount of gold for each life saved- not to mention a job well done rather than wholesale slaughter.

boardgame.name: Artifacts & Equipment: Death Shroud of the First Paladin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is little glory to be found in the tale of the First Paladin, and the Death Shroud serves as a physical token of the apology written in blood by the gods for their failure to answer the First Paladin’s pleas in a time of need. The legend goes that a once-peaceful land was ravaged by the forces of evil, until a youth, barely old enough to draw a blade, stood to oppose them.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules for magical items and equipment, this PDF introduces a new artifact - the Death Shroud of the First Paladin, a legendary cloak worthy of a grand campaign.

boardgame.name: Corfù 1716
boardgame.description:
Corfù 1716 is a wargame for two players simulating the last Venetian victory against the Ottoman Empire.

After the Morea War and the Passarowitz Peace (1699), with the Venetian reconquest of the Peloponnese area thanks to the great Doge Morosini, the Ottoman Empire seeks its revenge.
In 1715 the Empire is ready and with the Second Peloponnesian War, it recaptures, thanks to some fortunate events and the lack of competence of the Venetian Generals, all the Aegean islands and the whole Peloponnese.
Now the Ottoman Empire is ready to strike the Adriatic Sea, the Venetian Gulf itself.
Only the island and fortress of Corfù is guarding it.
It is defended by about 5000 soldiers, mostly German mercenaries, lead by Marshal Schulenberg, the Venetian Commander in Chief. 30000 ottoman soldiers tried to storm the fortress but after 20 days of heavy combats the Ottoman Army withdrew.
It would have been the last victory of the Serenissima, as it is called Venice. Antonio Vivaldi would have composed the oratory Juditha triunphans devicta Holofernis barbarie to celebrate this great victory.

In Corfù 1716 you will find 12 Venetian combat units, divided into 6 German Mercenary units, 3 Italian infantry units and 3 Ultramarine infantry and 20 Ottoman combat units, divided into 4 Janissaries units, 9 Kapikulu infantry and 7 auxiliary Serhaddkulu units representing the regiments and units employed during the siege.
There are two Morale chits for a total of 34 pieces, 2 d6s, a map, 9 Special Event Cards and the rules.

The map represents the area where the battle took place; it is used to register the orders and the consistency of the two armies.
The map is divided into Area, where to deploy the units and where the actions take place during the 20 turns.
There are the Combat Tables, with the result of the Combat and the Morale Track, which registers the Morale level of the two armies and the Turn Table.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Dozen Rumors of Lost Treasures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers crave riches, treasures that may either be turned into gold coins or items that can aid them in their next adventure. Always on the hunt for undiscovered treasures, the ears of any adventurer will perk up when they overhear the promise of lost treasures.

The twelve rumors described herein offer up a possibility at finding treasure . . . if the rumors are true. Each of the rumors that follow give the player characters just enough information to – if they act on the newfound knowledge – get the party into trouble. Many times, the rumors do not mention a specific treasure. Instead, the rumor is intended as an opportunity for the GM to introduce treasures of their choosing to the campaign. A vague “riches” is your invitation to select magic items, art objects, or other treasures from your favorite books.

True or False?

Since the release of the first entry in this series, I have offered both true and false options for every rumor. This was meant to give GMs the choice to decide which path to take with the rumors. After discussions with some of you, I now understand that you would like a system to determine which of the two to use in your campaign.

One mechanism for choosing true/false:

Whenever the adventurers overhear a rumor, ask that every PC secretly make a Wisdom check and pass the result to you on a scrap of paper. If more checks succeed than fail, the rumor is true. If the results are split equally, or more fail than succeed, the rumor is false.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Malefic Rumors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gamemasters, welcome one and all to the latest entry in the A Dozen . . . series of PDFs! With over 40 entries created in less than a year, and over 2,000 different Kickstarter project supporters, this series of PDFs is growing much faster than I would have ever guessed. Dozens upon dozens of different creative concepts that fantasy roleplaying game GMs – regardless of preferred system! – can turn to when in need of inspiration makes the series of immense value to gamemasters of all experience levels.

boardgame.name: Paths of Horror
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mother of Monsters stops and clutches at her distended belly. She screams as something wet falls out from her, a slithering mass of tissue and eyes, sopping with gore, a faint mewling cry escaping through its thin lips. Elsewhere, the catastrophist cackles with glee as the building housing the cultists collapses on their heads, killing everyone inside and causing no little mayhem in the surrounding community. And then there’s the verminist, who coos as she follows with her finger the bulges moving under her skin, each a knot of writhing maggots that flow through her veins. Surely, these people and others like them would never be considered heroes, but yet they fight the same fight as you. They use their peculiar talents in the ongoing effort to save Urth from annihilation.

To what lengths will you go to defeat the demonic incursion? What are you willing to sacrifice? Your body? Your mind? Your immortal soul? Paths of Horror continues to explore vile and unsettling master paths to offer characters with little regard for themselves or others opportunities to attain might, fortune, and glory in the world darkened by the Shadow of the Demon Lord. The contents of this supplement may not be suitable for all groups, so before you set your heart on one of the options contained herein, be sure to explain your intentions to and get approval from your fellow players and Game Master to ensure everyone has fun.

boardgame.name: Bridge Town (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play. An invaluable addition to any GM's armoury.

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the bridge towns in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play. An invaluable addition to any GM's armoury.

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note?
